thread.title: Fort Collins wildfire caused by cigarette butt, officials say
thread.title_full: Fort Collins wildfire caused by cigarette butt, officials say

author: Monte Whaley
title: Fort Collins wildfire caused by cigarette butt, officials say
text: Firefighters get handle on two wind-blown wildfires in Boulder County that prompted hundreds of evacuations February 10, 2017, 2:41 pm Firefighters in Boulder County have gotten a handle on two wildfires Friday morning that prompted the evacuation of nearly 300 homes and burned at least three structures. Fast-moving brush fire in Jefferson County leads to evacuations February 08, 2017, 2:48 pm The three- to five-acre fire is burning on a hillside north of Meyer Ranch Park, off U.S. 285, near Granzella Road, said Dan Hatlestad, deputy chief of Inter-Canyon Fire Rescue. Elbert County wildfire forces Saturday afternoon evacuations February 04, 2017, 7:52 pm The Elbert County Sheriff’s Office was asking residents in the Chaparral neighborhood to evacuate Saturday afternoon because a wildfire was threatening the neighborhood. “Once-in-a-lifetime shot”: Boulder man captures photo of three mountain lion cubs January 30, 2017, 7:35 pm Getting three kids to pose for a photo is hard enough. Imagine trying to pull that off when those three kids happen to be mountain lion cubs.
